intro: Psychotria chocoana, commonly known as the Chocó psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly in the Chocó region of Colombia and Ecuador. The plant is characterized by its dark green, elliptical leaves and produces small, white to pale yellow flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland and montane rainforests. Psychotria chocoana is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional medicine by indigenous communities.
